norm1.subject: employer or employment agency
norm1.action: use an automated employment decision tool to screen a candidate or employee for an employment decision
norm1.conditions: unless such tool has been subject to a bias audit conducted no more than one year prior to the use of such tool
norm1.text_snippet: It shall be unlawful for an employer or employment agency to use an automated employment decision tool to screen a candidate or employee for an employment decision unless: 1. Such tool has been subject to a bias audit conducted no more than one year prior to the use of such tool

norm2.subject: employer or employment agency
norm2.action: use an automated employment decision tool to screen a candidate or employee for an employment decision
norm2.conditions: unless the tool has been subject to a bias audit conducted no more than one year prior to use AND a summary of the most recent bias audit results is publicly available on the website
norm2.text_snippet: It shall be unlawful for an employer or employment agency to use an automated employment decision tool to screen a candidate or employee for an employment decision unless: 1. Such tool has been subject to a bias audit conducted no more than one year prior to the use of such tool; and 2. A summary of the results of the most recent bias audit of such tool is publicly available on the website of the employer or employment agency using such tool.

conflicts.description: Condition inconsistency: 'use an automated employment decision tool to screen a candidate or employee for an employment decision' has different conditions in final_rules vs local_law

resolution.rationale: Applying lex superior: statute (in local_law) has higher authority than regulation (in final_rules)
